title: Day in the Life of an IL Dairy Farmer #shorts

subtasks: Wake up at 4 a.m.
Enjoy a glass of fresh milk
Greet the cows in the barn
Prepare to milk 12 cows at a time (6 on each side)
Clean the cow's teats
Attach the milking machine
Assist the cow in letdown with gentle pulsation
Collect milk into whey jars
Transfer milk to the bulk tank for cooling
Feed the calves
Complete other daily chores
Spend extra time with Gloria's red baby calf
Begin milking again around 4 p.m.
Thank the viewer for joining the farm tour

tasks.task: Starting with the MAINTASK of the day starting around 4 a.m. Then under that, the subtasks would be waking up, having the milk, going to meet the cows, and then the milking process. That includes cleaning teats, placing the machine, letting down the milk, collecting into jars, and then to the bulk tank. Then after milking, they deal with the calves and other chores. Finally, start milking again in the evening. The thank you at the end is probably a general thank you for watching, so maybe a separate subtask for that. The mention of Gloria's calf might just be a part of routine where they spend extra time with the calf, which is a chore but maybe a bit more personal.
